result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey J. Hoppe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: --pay costs, fees and surcharges = $543,  within 60 days or to setup a payment plan within 60 days, Non-payment shall result in a 20 days jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

--serve 20 days in Jefferson County Jail

The Court orders the Defendant to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office today for DNA sample provision.

(SF) Case called at 02:15 PM 
Defendant Jeffrey J. Hoppe in court, in custody with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Beck presents sentencing recommendations; advises that there is vicitm rights compliance.
Attorney Zarwell presents sentecing argument.

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 20 days in Jefferson County Jail
--2 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs, fees and surcharges = $543,  within 60 days or to setup a payment plan within 60 days, Non-payment shall result in a 20 days jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

The Court orders the Defendant to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office today for DNA sample provision.

[MK] cases #18CF211 and #15CM502 called at 11:10am. 
Defendant Jeffrey J. Hoppe in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

As to Case #15CM502: 
--after a review of the file and the information that Branch II granted the Motion to Revoke the previous Deferred Prosecution and thereafter adjudicated Mr. Hoppe to be guilty, the Court directs the clerk to transfer this case from being assigned to Judge Weston to now be assigned to Judge Hue/Branch II. 
--------------------- 
As to Case #18CF211 the Preliminary Hearing is held:
Officer Jarred Gonzalez- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA 
Hall
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Hoppe committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial 
recess 
11:23am 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/1/18 at 10:00am,  (2) Status Conference on 8/21/18 at 9:30am  (JA: as to case #15CM502 please note in comments that the case is at the Sentencing stage after DPA revocation, but tracking at this point)
Status conference on June 28, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Attorney DeLaRosa

[MK] cases #18CF211 and #15CM502 called at 9:11am. 
Defendant Jeffrey J. Hoppe in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
As to Case #18CF211:  
--The case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today and the State's officer-witness is present.  However Attorney Huebner clarifies that he has only been appointed as counsel in the misdemeanor case.  Mr. Hoppe is not represented by counsel on the felony case.  Attorney Huebner will put in a request to the Public Defenders Office for Mr. Hoppe to be evaluated for eligibility. 
--Service of the Amended Complaint is admitted 
------------------------
As to Case #15CM502: 
--After hearing arguments from counsel on the State's 5/16/18 Motion to Revoke the DPA, the Court grants the Motion and adjudicates Mr. Hoppe guilty in that case. 
recess 9:19am. 


NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on #18CF211 and Status Conference in Case #15CM502 (JA, note in comments that even though this is a status hearing, the case is at the Sentencing stage after DPA revocation) --both on 6/28/18 at 11:00am  (Mr. Hoppe is currently on a DOC hold in the Jefferson County Jail)

ADA Hall withdraws motion to revoke and instead motions the Court to extend the Deferred Prosecution Agreement
The Court grants the motion to extend DPA for one year or until Mr. Hoppe completes Certified Batterers Intervention program, whichever comes first.
Mr. Hoppe indicates he is in the process of applying to program/on waiting list.

Case called at 4:05 am [sf]
Defendant Jeffrey J. Hoppe in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court goes over Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Plea Questionnaire with the defendant.
Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, stays proceedings. 
ADA Shock presents recommendation regarding Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
Attorney Huebner presents agruments in favor of the Court accepting the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

Court strikes the not to discuss the facts of the case Amanda Hoppe from the bond.
ADA Shock advises the court that there is a victim impact statement and gives a brief synopsis of the statement
Court accepts the Deferred Prosecution Agreement defers any entry of Judgment untila  later date, if the defendant completes the deferred prosecution agreement the case will be dismiss. Court signs the Order as submitted.

ADA Shock will send a copy of the Order to the Probation.
  
recess: 4:17 pm

Case called at 1:20 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jeffrey J. Hoppe appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Hagemann informs the Court that SPD is appearing for bond purposes only, Mr. Hoppe is not eligible for SPD services

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-Take all prescription drugs as prescribed
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Amanda Hoppe
Recess: 1:25 pm
